examples.translation: I did it so that you would (be able to) go.
I did it so that they would (be able to) go.

examples.text: Seni öpersem biliyorum ki, sana âşık olacağım.
examples.translation: If I kiss you, I know that I'll fall in love with you.

glosses: Used after a nominal phrase as an emphatic, acting as if there is an implied consequence of the phrase, equivalent to English so ... that

examples.text: O kadar güzelsin ki! (gözlerinin içine sonsuza dek bakabilirim).
examples.translation: You are so beautiful! (that I can look into your eyes forever).

examples.text: O kadar uykum var ki (her an bayılabilirim gibi hissediyorum).
examples.translation: I'm so tired (that I feel like I'm going to pass out any moment).

examples.text: Neden ondan korkuyorsun? O bir halt yapmaz ki.
examples.translation: Why are you even afraid of them? They won’t do shit anyways.

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish كه (ki), from Classical Persian که.
